metaDescription:
Sumsub is the one verification platform to secure the whole user journey. With Sumsub's customizable KYC, KYB, transaction monitoring and fraud prevention solutions, you can orchestrate your verification process, welcome more customers worldwide, meet compliance requirements, reduce costs and protect your business.

Sumsub has over 2,000 clients in fintech, crypto, transportation, trading, e-commerce and gaming industries including Binance, Wirex, Avis, Bybit, Huobi, Unlimit, Flutter, Kaizen Gaming, and TransferGo.
apiDescription:
Sumsub is the one verification platform to secure the whole user journey. With Sumsub's customizable KYC, KYB, transaction monitoring and fraud prevention solutions, you can orchestrate your verification process, welcome more customers worldwide, meet compliance requirements, reduce costs and protect your business.

Sumsub has over 2,000 clients in fintech, crypto, transportation, trading, e-commerce and gaming industries including Binance, Wirex, Avis, Bybit, Huobi, Unlimit, Flutter, Kaizen Gaming, and TransferGo.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A [verification level](https://docs.sumsub.com/reference) name. Case-sensitive and must be created in the same [environment](https://docs.sumsub.com/reference). If contains reserved characters (e.g., `@`, `+"`, white spaces as `%20`), it should be URL-encoded, otherwise you may get signature mismatch.

parameters.name: levelName
parameters.description: A [verification level](https://docs.sumsub.com/reference) name. Case-sensitive and must be created in the same [environment](https://docs.sumsub.com/reference). If contains reserved characters (e.g., `@`, `+"`, white spaces as `%20`), it should be URL-encoded, otherwise you may get signature mismatch.

methods.description: Import applicant with images by archive
Set review for applicant in sandbox
Add and overwrite custom applicant tags

parameters.name: reason
parameters.description: A note indicating the reason for checking the applicant profile.

parameters.name: note
parameters.description: A note indicating the reason for blocklisting the applicant profile.

parameters.name: revert
parameters.description: Set `true` to revert inactivity of the image.

parameters.name: inspectionId
parameters.description: An inspection identifier. You can get this number by using [this API method](ref:get-applicant-data).

parameters.name: imageId
parameters.description: An image identifier. You can get this number by using [this API method](ref:get-applicant-verification-steps-status).

parameters.name: inspectionId
parameters.description: An inspection identifier. This identifier is returned as a root field upon running [this API method](ref:get-applicant-data).

parameters.name: imageId
parameters.description: An image identifier. You can get this number by using [this API method](ref:get-applicant-verification-steps-status).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Possible values: `deactivated` to deactivate the applicant profile. `activated` to reactivate the applicant profile.

parameters.name: applicantId
parameters.description: A unique identifier of an applicant profile to which a consent should be added.

parameters.name: externalUserId
parameters.description: A unique applicant identifier in your system.

parameters.name: ttlInSecs
parameters.description: A lifespan of the link in seconds.

parameters.name: externalUserId
parameters.description: An external user ID on your side.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description: The language for WebSDK in ISO 639-1 format.

parameters.name: levelName
parameters.description: A [verification level](https://docs.sumsub.com/reference) name. Case-sensitive and has to be created in the same environment. If contains reserved characters (e.g., `@`, `+"`, white spaces as `%20`), it should be URL-encoded, otherwise you may get signature mismatch.

parameters.name: ttlInSecs
parameters.description: A lifespan of a token in seconds. Default value is 10 mins.

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: An external user ID which will be bound to the token.

parameters.name: externalActionId
parameters.description: An external action ID which will be bound to the token.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Limit of applicant actions to be returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of applicant actions to be returned.

parameters.name: levelName
parameters.description: A name of the level configured in the dashboard.

parameters.name: levelName
parameters.description: A verification level name for which you want to create a payment source action.

parameters.name: xExternalActionId
parameters.description: Use `externalActionId` if you intend to [initialize SDK](ref:about-applicant-actions) for that particular action.

parameters.name: requireSelfie
parameters.description: Sets the video selfie at `requiredIdDocs` for the action.

parameters.name: isPreview
parameters.description: Indicates if an image thumbnail should be returned.

methods.description: Submit applicant data for non-doc verification
Confirm applicant data for non-doc verification

parameters.name: confirmationId
parameters.description: A confirmation identifier from the [submission](ref:submit-applicant-data) response.

parameters.name: applicantId
parameters.description: A unique identification number of the applicant who passed user verification (https://docs.sumsub.com/reference. If you do no have such an applicant, use [Submit transaction for non-existing applicant](ref:submit-transaction-for-non-existing-applicant) instead.

parameters.name: levelName
parameters.description: A [verification level](https://docs.sumsub.com/reference) name. Case-sensitive and has to be created in the same environment. If contains reserved characters (e.g., `@`, `+"`, white spaces as `%20`), it should be URL-encoded, otherwise you may get signature mismatch.

parameters.name: externalTxnId
parameters.description: A unique transaction identifier on your side.

parameters.name: ignoreErrors
parameters.description:
• true all valid transactions will be created and returned, errors will be ignored during the processing and listed in the response.
  • false (https://docs.sumsub.com/reference valid transactions will be created up to the first detected error. The response will only contain the error on which the processing was interrupted.

parameters.name: scoreSavedTxns
parameters.description:
Allows you to control whether scoring should be run on imported transactions or not:
  • true (https://docs.sumsub.com/reference start scoring after import.
  • false do not start scoring after import.

parameters.name: unsetKeys
parameters.description: A list of property names separated by commas that should be set to `null`.

methods.description: Patch transaction with chain transaction ID

parameters.name: applicantId
parameters.description: A unique applicant identifier who should own the transaction.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of the VASPs to be returned. The maximum recommended value you can set is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the VASPs to be returned.

parameters.name: accessToken
parameters.description: Access token that you have [received at the first step](ref:generate-access-token-fisherman) of the flow.

parameters.name: subjectName
parameters.description: The name of the subject for which events are received. If the name is not specified, the events are received for all subjects on the key.

parameters.name: activity
parameters.description: If specified, only the events with this activity will be in the response.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Date/time events are received from (`yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss`, e.g. 2022-10-01 12:05:00). If not specified, the events are received from the day before.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: To the date/time events are received (`yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss`, e.g. 2022-10-01 12:15:00). If not specified, the events are received up to the present moment.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of events per request. Cannot be more than 20000. By default is 10.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Allows to skip the offset events before beginning to return the events. By default is 0.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the found networks to be returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of the found networks to be returned. The maximum value you can set is 100.

repositoryDescription: Sumsub is a verification platform offering KYC, KYB, transaction monitoring, and fraud prevention solutions. Trusted by 2,000+ clients in fintech, crypto, transportation, trading, e-commerce, and gaming sectors. Sumsub's {language} SDK generated by Konfig (https://konfigthis.com/).
